billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO VETERANS, HOMELAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS

title: Entitles every veteran or disabled veteran who has served in more than one time of war additional credit in competitive exams
summary: Provides that every person who has served in more than one time of war shall be entitled to additional credit as a veteran or disabled veteran in competitive examinations for original appointment or promotion for every such time of war during which person served, regardless of whether any such person has utilized such credit for a competitive examination for original appointment or a competitive examination for promotion.

       AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to the use of credits
         for veterans and disabled veterans

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  4  of section 85 of the civil service law is
    2  amended by adding a new paragraph (e) to read as follows:
    3    (E) EVERY PERSON WHO HAS SERVED IN MORE THAN ONE TIME OF WAR SHALL  BE
    4  ENTITLED  TO THE ADDITIONAL CREDIT PROVIDED HEREIN AS A VETERAN OR DISA-
    5  BLED VETERAN, IN COMPETITIVE EXAMINATIONS FOR  ORIGINAL  APPOINTMENT  OR
    6  PROMOTION  FOR  EVERY  SUCH TIME OF WAR DURING WHICH SUCH PERSON SERVED,
    7  REGARDLESS OF WHETHER ANY SUCH PERSON HAS UTILIZED  SUCH  CREDIT  FOR  A
    8  COMPETITIVE  EXAMINATION FOR ORIGINAL APPOINTMENT OR A COMPETITIVE EXAM-
    9  INATION FOR PROMOTION.
   10    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2257

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the civil service law, in relation to the use of credits for
veterans and disabled veterans

PURPOSE:
To allow the use of additional credits
allowed to veterans
and disabled veterans on Civil Service examinations. This legislation
would allow a person who has served during more than one time of war
to utilize additional credit regardless of whether the veteran or
disabled veteran has previously utilized veterans' credits for
original appointment or for promotion.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
This bill will add a new
Section 4(e) to
Section 85 of the Civil Service Law which will allow for additional
Civil Service credits for veterans who served in more than one time
of war.

EXISTING LAW:
Currently, a veteran who has served in
more than one
time of war is prohibited from receiving additional credits for the
additional service.

JUSTIFICATION:
This bill would allow additional
credit to a veteran
who has received "veterans credit" previously on a Civil Service
examination and who subsequently answered the call to duty during
another time of war. This bill would reward those who have served in
more than one conflict and it provides an incentive for our citizens
to continue participating in the reserve components of our armed
forces.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediately.
